DONUT_GLAZED.NAME: Glazed Donut
DONUT_GLAZED.COPY: Just as fatty and bad for you as a normal donut but with EXTRA sugar to increase the waistline even further.

DONUT.NAME: Donut
DONUT.COPY: Homer's favourite: fat, sugar and more fat. You only have to look at his waistline to see the effect they can have on your own body. D'oh!

ENERGY_DRINK.NAME: Energy Drink
ENERGY_DRINK.COPY: Yes it will give you a boost...but only because it is so full of sugar!

LEMONADE.NAME: Lemonade
LEMONADE.COPY: It's water, a LOT of sugar and lemon flavouring. Your body will use those calories first then convert your food to fat, woohoo!

ORANGEADE.NAME: Orangeade
ORANGEADE.COPY: It's water, a LOT of sugar and orange flavouring. Your body will use those calories first then convert your food to fat, woohoo!

COLA.NAME: Cola
COLA.COPY: It's water, a LOT of sugar and cola flavouring. Your body will use those calories first then convert your food to fat, woohoo!

BEANS.NAME: Baked Beans
BEANS.COPY: "Beans, beans, good for your heart. The more you eat the more you fart!" Who knew you were receiving nutrition advice in the playground?

LENTILS.NAME: Lentils
LENTILS.COPY: Vegetarians know their power: add herbs or spices to them to improve your interest. Lentils, that is - not vegetarians...

ONION.NAME: Onion
ONION.COPY: Versatile and ubiquitous, they are edible raw or gently fried as part of something bigger and are an easy part of your 5 fruit-and-veg a day.

GREEN_PEPPER.NAME: Green Pepper
GREEN_PEPPER.COPY: Interesting fact: contains vitamin C but half as much as its brother the red pepper

CAULIFLOWER.NAME: Cauliflower
CAULIFLOWER.COPY: Low in fat, high in dietary fibre, lots of calcium, what more can you ask? Don't boil it to a mush though.

BROCCOLI.NAME: Broccoli
BROCCOLI.COPY: Superfood! Rich in the antioxidants vitamin C and beta-carotene, as well as folate - all of which can protect against cardiovascular disease and cancer.

SPROUTS.NAME: Sprouts
SPROUTS.COPY: Don't feel sorry for the humble sprout. They taste better than they smell and being high in folic acid can help prevent heart disease too.

ASPARAGUS.NAME: Asparagus
ASPARAGUS.COPY: It may make your wee smell, but in some countries it's an aphrodisiac (The asaparagus, not your wee).

CELERY.NAME: Celery
CELERY.COPY: Its potassium content helps maintain nerves and muscles too.

PRUNES.NAME: Prunes
PRUNES.COPY: These sweet, wrinkled beauties can really get things moving and keep your gut healthy. "Better out than in", as they say.

FROZEN_SPINACH.NAME: Frozen Spinach
FROZEN_SPINACH.COPY: Flash-frozen from the field, frozen spinach is just as healthy as fresh.

SPINACH.NAME: Spinach
SPINACH.COPY: Versatile as you can eat it raw, boiled or steamed. High in iron, which helps your blood cells circulate oxygen round your body.

TINNED_SPINACH.NAME: Tinned Spinach
TINNED_SPINACH.COPY: Not as good for you as the fresh stuff, but eating any vegetables is better than none!

EGG.NAME: Egg
EGG.COPY: Full of proteins and vitamins, eggs are super foods! Scrambled, boiled or poached, they are delicious!

BOILED_EGG.NAME: Boiled Egg
BOILED_EGG.COPY: Nothing could be simpler to cook. Line up some soldiers and you'll have full battle strength! Full of vitamins and proteins.

FRIED_EGG.NAME: Fried Egg
FRIED_EGG.COPY: OK, eggs are superfood! But fried means adding lots of fat, so it's not as healthy as a boiled one.

CHICKEN_FILLET.NAME: Chicken Fillet
CHICKEN_FILLET.COPY: Grilled, stir fried on in a curry sauce, they are packed with protein. The healthiest way to eat a chook is without the skin on.

GRILLED_STEAK.NAME: Grilled Steak
GRILLED_STEAK.COPY: Be brave, go rare! Lean red meat is high in protein and very good for you, but if you cremate it you'll be left with an old leather sole.

FATTY_STEAK.NAME: Fatty Steak
FATTY_STEAK.COPY: The clue is in the title - eat too much fat and you'll go the same way. Fat is essential for your cells but not waistline.

FISH.NAME: White Fish
FISH.COPY: Fish in almost all forms is low in fat good for you and your heart. No, that doesn't include deep fried and battered with a side of fries.

GRILLED_FISH.NAME: Grilled White Fish
GRILLED_FISH.COPY: Grilled with some lemon, garlic and parsley, it's well pucka! As Mr Oliver says, "Please may I have some more?"

BATTERED_FISH.NAME: Battered White Fish
BATTERED_FISH.COPY: Treat it as a treat...not as healthy as baked, boiled or grilled fish and the less said about the chips the better.

WHOLEGRAIN_BREAD.NAME: Whole Grain Bread
WHOLEGRAIN_BREAD.COPY: Like all carbohydrates, whole grain bread is a great source of slow release energy and the whole grain has extra minerals and fibre.

WHOLEGRAIN_PASTA.NAME: Whole Grain Pasta
WHOLEGRAIN_PASTA.COPY: Like all carbohydrates, pasta is a great source of slow release energy and the whole grain has extra minerals and fibre.

WHOLEGRAIN_BAGEL.NAME: Whole Grain Bagel
WHOLEGRAIN_BAGEL.COPY: Like all carbohydrates, whole grain bread is a great source of slow release energy. The whole grain contains extra minerals and fibre.

WHOLEGRAIN_CRACKER.NAME: Whole Grain Cracker
WHOLEGRAIN_CRACKER.COPY: Like all carbohydrates, whole grain cracker is a great source of slow release energy and the whole grain has extra minerals and fibre.

POTATOES.NAME: Potato
POTATOES.COPY: Boiled potatoes are full of good things and keep you full for longer with lots of slow release carbohydrates.

BANANA.NAME: Bananas
BANANA.COPY: From green to yellow to brown. It can have different tastes, from starchy to very sweet. It is rich in potassium and so good after a workout!

PORRIDGE.NAME: Porridge
PORRIDGE.COPY: Packed with slow release energy, phytochemicals and antioxidants. These can help prevent heart diseases and certain cancers but avoid the added sugar versions if you can.

WHITE_BREAD.NAME: White Bread
WHITE_BREAD.COPY: Like all carbohydrates, bread is a great source of slow release energy.

WHITE_PASTA.NAME: White Pasta
WHITE_PASTA.COPY: Like all carbohydrates, pasta is a great source of slow release energy and goes with virtually everything.

WHITE_BAGEL.NAME: White Bagel
WHITE_BAGEL.COPY: Like all carbohydrates, bagels are a great source of slow release energy and contain extra calcium.

BREAKFAST_CEREAL.NAME: Breakfast Cereal
BREAKFAST_CEREAL.COPY: Some breakfast cereals have as much sugar as a can of cola. Brown toast or porridge would be a better option.

WHITE_RICE.NAME: White Rice
WHITE_RICE.COPY: Billions of people can't be wrong. Simple to cook with lots of energy there's not a bad word to be said. Brown rice has extra minerals and fibre.

ORANGE_SQUASH.NAME: Orange juice
ORANGE_SQUASH.COPY: If you can't get them fresh, then freshly squeezed is just as good. Lots of natural sugar will give you a quick energy boost.

APPLEJUICE.NAME: Apple Juice
APPLEJUICE.COPY: An almost instant natural sugar boost for your body. Aim for pressed juice if you can or a real apple is even better.

COOKIE.NAME: Cookie
COOKIE.COPY: If a cookie monster really ate all those cookies he'd be the size of a house! Biscuits are a treat, not a way of life.

SWEET.NAME: Sweet
SWEET.COPY: It really is just like eating a spoonful of sugar, with some colouring. Fast burn energy is the only result.

BURGER.NAME: Burger
BURGER.COPY: The epitome of fast food, McFatAss grew large on these. Home-made ones can be good for you but fast food burgers will make your heart suffer.

BURGER_CHICKEN.NAME: Chicken Burger
BURGER_CHICKEN.COPY: The chicken might have protein, but it's been seriously abused by all the mayonnaise, salt, ketchup and fried breadcrumbs.

FRENCHFRIES.NAME: French Fries
FRENCHFRIES.COPY: Plain potatoes contain 0% fat. French fried versions contain nearly 50% fat. If that doesn't knock you over the extra salt and sugar will.

MILK.NAME: Milk
MILK.COPY: Your bones & teeth will thank milk as it contains a mineral called calcium which is vital for their strength. A full fat option is best for young children.

MILK_SEMI.NAME: Semi-skimmed Milk
MILK_SEMI.COPY: A good balance between lower fat content but all the goodness of calcium that milk is best at.

MILK_SKIMMED.NAME: Skimmed Milk
MILK_SKIMMED.COPY: Less fat than any of the other milk! Good for people losing weight, but not good for babies' brains.

CHEESE.NAME: Cheese
CHEESE.COPY: Oh so cheesy but a rich source of calcium for strong bones. Watch the saturated fat and added salt though, it'll make your heart sad.

YOGHURT.NAME: Yoghurt
YOGHURT.COPY: A once simple food that's all too often mutated into a sugar filled, artificially flavoured dessert, so stick with natural varieties.

LOWFAT_YOGHURT.NAME: Low Fat Yoghurt
LOWFAT_YOGHURT.COPY: Don't be fooled! Low fat doesn't mean low calories, just check the sugar content and additive list.

FRIED_CHICKEN.NAME: Fried Chicken
FRIED_CHICKEN.COPY: Deep fried for your body's displeasure.

MC_BURGER.NAME: Dbl. Cheeseburger
MC_BURGER.COPY: All the downsides of a hamburger, but with extra cheese just to add insult to injury. A truly tasty but dangerous food.

MC_WINGS.NAME: Fried Wings
MC_WINGS.COPY: Take the piece of the chicken with the least meat and most fat and deep fry it to make it twice as bad for you.

MC_NUGGETS.NAME: Nuggets
MC_NUGGETS.COPY: Really just a breaded slurry of chicken skin, tendons, salt, water and preservatives. Mmmm, skin and tendons...

MC_NACHOS.NAME: Nachos
MC_NACHOS.COPY: Deep fried corn covered in melted cheese. Sounds good, but you may as well dip your heart in cheese too.

MC_MUFFIN.NAME: Breakfast Muffin
MC_MUFFIN.COPY: Like all breads, contains lots of carbohydrates. It's what's between the buns that gives cause for concern.

MC_MEAL.NAME: Crappy Meal
MC_MEAL.COPY: A simple way of getting little kids to eat junk food. It usually contains as much packaging as food.

MC_BUCKET.NAME: Sharing Bucket
MC_BUCKET.COPY: There's enough fat in a bucket of fried chicken to sustain an army. If you're eating this alone you should be worried.

MC_KEBAB.NAME: Kebab
MC_KEBAB.COPY: A chicken shish kebab and salad is actually a good meal, but a tired greasy lamb doner and chips is a time bomb for your body.

MC_HOTDOG.NAME: Hotdog
MC_HOTDOG.COPY: It's meat from every part of beast, and we mean EVERY part. A neat little wiener hiding a multitude of sins.

MC_FISH.NAME: Fish and Chips
MC_FISH.COPY: Fish and fat, fat and chips, chish and fips, whatever you call it, eat sparingly. It does not do wonders for your body.

MC_SHAKE_BANANA.NAME: Banana Milkshake
MC_SHAKE_BANANA.COPY: What was once a healthy glass of milk is now full of extra sugar, flavourings and additives. Next time try making it fresh at home with real fruit.

MC_SHAKE_CHOCOLATE.NAME: Chocolate Milkshake
MC_SHAKE_CHOCOLATE.COPY: What was once a healthy glass of milk is now full of extra sugar, flavourings and additives.

MC_SHAKE_STRAWBERRY.NAME: Berry Milkshake
MC_SHAKE_STRAWBERRY.COPY: What was once a healthy glass of milk is now full of extra sugar, flavourings and additives. Next time try making it fresh at home with real fruit.

MC_SLURRY_CHOCOLATE.NAME: Dbl Choc Mr.Slurry
MC_SLURRY_CHOCOLATE.COPY: Take one cheap ice cream dessert and add extra sugar and artificial chocolate sauce to give you a size boost.

MC_SLURRY_BERRY.NAME: Berry Mr.Slurry
MC_SLURRY_BERRY.COPY: Take one cheap ice cream desert and add extra sugar and artificial berry sauce to give you a size boost.

MC_SLURRY_BANANA.NAME: Banana Mr.Slurry
MC_SLURRY_BANANA.COPY: Take one cheap ice cream dessert and add extra sugar and artificial banana sauce to give you a size boost.

RASPBERRY.NAME: Raspberry
RASPBERRY.COPY: Another great British summer fruit packed with vitamin C and super sweet as a treat.

STRAWBERRY.NAME: Strawberry
STRAWBERRY.COPY: A summer favourite and only the real deal will do. Packed with vitamin C, they couldn't be better for you.

APPLE.NAME: Apple
APPLE.COPY: "An apple a day keeps the doctor away". Perhaps not entirely true but sweet crunchy fruit is very good for your body and teeth.

TOMATOE.NAME: Tomato
TOMATOE.COPY: Superfood! They are full of Vitamin C and Beta carotene.

TOMATOE_CANNED.NAME: Canned Tomato
TOMATOE_CANNED.COPY: Not as much Vitamin C as fresh tomatoes, but they're great in pasta sauces, curries or simply on toast.

ESPRESSO.NAME: Espresso
ESPRESSO.COPY: A short, quick hit of caffeine to get the body and mind moving faster. Too much coffee can have strange effects.

COFFEE.NAME: Coffee
COFFEE.COPY: Coffee contains caffeine which stimulates the body and mind to get you moving double time.

TEA.NAME: Tea
TEA.COPY: Tea has about half the caffeine of a cup of coffee but still acts as a stimulant to the body and mind.

SPAHGETTI_HOOPS.NAME: Spaghetti Hoops
SPAHGETTI_HOOPS.COPY: In the time it takes to open a tin and reheat you could have cooked fresh pasta! Too much sugar in the sauce but a good source of energy.

ALLSORT_ROUND_ORANGE.NAME: Orange Sweet
ALLSORT_ROUND_ORANGE.COPY: It really is just like eating a spoonful of sugar, with some orange colouring. Fast burn energy is the only result.

ALLSORT_ROUND_PINK.NAME: Bubblegum Sweet
ALLSORT_ROUND_PINK.COPY: It really is just like eating a spoonful of sugar, with some pink colouring. Fast burn energy is the only result.

ALLSORT_SQUARE_ORANGE.NAME: Liquorice Sweet
ALLSORT_SQUARE_ORANGE.COPY: It really is just like eating a spoonful of sugar, with some orange colouring. Fast burn energy is the only result.

ALLSORT_SQUARE_PINK.NAME: Liquorice Sweet
ALLSORT_SQUARE_PINK.COPY: It really is just like eating a spoonful of sugar, with some pink colouring. Fast burn energy is the only result.

CARROT.NAME: Carrot
CARROT.COPY: Millions of rabbits can't be wrong! They are rich in the antioxidant beta-carotene. Crunch them raw, or gently cook for 10 minutes, they'll give you lots of bounce.

ORANGE.NAME: Orange
ORANGE.COPY: Oranges are not the only fruit of course, but this staple juicer is great sliced, sucked or squeezed.

BACON_SANDWICH.NAME: Bacon Sandwich
BACON_SANDWICH.COPY: Bacon sarnies are virtually a staple food in some homes. Trim the fat and grill the bacon for a better behaved body.

CHEESE_SANDWICH.NAME: Cheese Sandwich
CHEESE_SANDWICH.COPY: Cheese and pickle, a ploughman's favourite. If you eat it all the time then go for reduced fat version.

JAM_SANDWICH.NAME: Jam Sandwich
JAM_SANDWICH.COPY: Sugar plus fruit equals Jam. Between the carbohydrates in the bread and the jam it's got a lot of energy.

NEW_POTATOE.NAME: New Potato
NEW_POTATOE.COPY: Boiled potatoes are packed with good things and keep you full for longer with lots of slow release carbohydrates.

JACKET_POTATOE.NAME: Jacket Potato
JACKET_POTATOE.COPY: A great meal in a jacket, eat with skin on and go easy on the mayonnaise and butter. Beans or Tuna is better.

BREAKFAST_CEREAL_WHOLE.NAME: Muesli
BREAKFAST_CEREAL_WHOLE.COPY: Wholegrain cereals are high in fiber and give you energy throughout the day. They have lots of good minerals and vitamins for a healthy body.

CHOCOLATE_BAR.NAME: Chocolate Bar
CHOCOLATE_BAR.COPY: Delicious! Don't over eat it though!

ICECREAM_STRAWBERRY.NAME: Berry Ice-cream
ICECREAM_STRAWBERRY.COPY: A creamy mix of cream eggs and sugar the energy levels are eye watering. Can be high in saturated fat.

ICECREAM_VANILLA.NAME: Vanilla Ice-cream
ICECREAM_VANILLA.COPY: A creamy mix of cream eggs and sugar the energy levels are eye watering. Can be high in saturated fat.

ICECREAM_CHOCOLATE.NAME: Chocolate Ice-cream
ICECREAM_CHOCOLATE.COPY: A creamy mix of cream, eggs and sugar, the energy levels are eye watering. However, it can be high in saturated fat.

FISH_FINGER.NAME: Fish Finger
FISH_FINGER.COPY: It's the deep-fried breadcrumbs that bring this little fishy dish down. Frozen fillets would be better.

PIZZA.NAME: Pizza
PIZZA.COPY: Pizza can be healthy, but not when covered in a meat feast and double cheesy crust. Pile on the veg instead!

SAUSAGE.NAME: Sausage
SAUSAGE.COPY: Good and evil, sausages might contain good minerals, but also lots of saturated fat and salt, not ideal for a healthy heart.

MICROWAVE_CURRY.NAME: Micro Lasagne
MICROWAVE_CURRY.COPY: A true TV dinner for couch potatoes everywhere! Lots of saturated fat from the fatty mince and cheese.

MICROWAVE_LASAGNE.NAME: Micro Curry
MICROWAVE_LASAGNE.COPY: Some takeaway curries are literally swimming in oil and salt, and your heart will be drowning in them.

PEA.NAME: Pea
PEA.COPY: Peas are high in fibre, protein, vitamins and minerals.

KIDNEY_BEANS.NAME: Kidney Beans
KIDNEY_BEANS.COPY: Kidney beans are a very good source of cholesterol-lowering fibre and packed with minerals.

CASHEW.NAME: Cashew nuts
CASHEW.COPY: Raw is best, but even roasted, salted or sugared these nuts pack a mix of nutrients and minerals not found in many foods.

SARDINES.NAME: Sardines
SARDINES.COPY: It's sad to see these little nutritional powerhouses squashed in their tins. Liberate some today and reap the benefits of Omega 3 in your diet!

LAMB.NAME: Lamb
LAMB.COPY: Cute to look at but even better with mint sauce. Full of proteins which help structure our cells and fuel us with energy.

BRAZIL_NUTS.NAME: Brazil nuts
BRAZIL_NUTS.COPY: Go nuts for a Brazilian! Their proteins contain all the necessary amino acids to foster optimal growth in the human body. They are rich in the mineral selenium.

SHELLFISH.NAME: Shellfish
SHELLFISH.COPY: The UK's seas are full of some of the best. Low in fat, fast to cook, loads of protein, magnesium & vitamin B. There's more to them than a prawn cocktail.

RED_PEPPER.NAME: Red Pepper
RED_PEPPER.COPY: Contains double the amount of vitamin C than its brother, the green pepper

FIGS.NAME: Figs
FIGS.COPY: One of the highest plant sources of fibre, calcium and iron. It'll make you go far!

APRICOT.NAME: Apricot
APRICOT.COPY: Rich in fibre, iron and beta carotene, dried apricots can be used to relieve constipation. Drink plenty of water too!

GREEN_BEANS.NAME: Green beans
GREEN_BEANS.COPY: Green beans come in all shapes and sizes. Containing lots of vitamin B essential for your health, but don't overcook them.

PLUMS.NAME: Plums
PLUMS.COPY: Purple, yellow or red, grab a couple of ripe ones today. They have as much beta-carotene as Carrots.

MELON.NAME: Melon
MELON.COPY: They can be called a fruit or a plant, and taste great naked or with yoghurt on top.

CABBAGE.NAME: Cabbage
CABBAGE.COPY: The unsung hero in the prevention against Cancer. Just don't cook it too long!

FROMAGE_FRAIS.NAME: Fromage Frais
FROMAGE_FRAIS.COPY: Dairy foods are yummy but opt for the low fat varieties!

CREAM_CHEESE.NAME: Cream Cheese
CREAM_CHEESE.COPY: Easy to add to potatoes and pasta. Packs a lot of flavour but can have a lot of saturated fat too.

CREAM.NAME: Double Cream
CREAM.COPY: It's full of fat. Need we say more?

BACON.NAME: Bacon
BACON.COPY: If fried in fat you'll be mopping up the grease and clogging up your arteries, but grill it and it's much more healthy.

OILY_FISH.NAME: Oily Fish
OILY_FISH.COPY: Oily fish are rich in Omega-3, great for the heart and the brain. For you, not the fish.

BUTTER.NAME: Butter
BUTTER.COPY: The original spread of dairy, fats and salt. Fats are essential to healthy cells, but not if they are saturated fats.
